      • copySign

        public static double copySign(double from,
                              double to)
        Copies sign from one variable into the other
        Parameters:
        from - variable to copy sign from
        to - variable to apply it to
        Returns:
        abs(to) if from positive, -abs(to) if from negative, 0 if from=0

      • expScale

        public static double expScale(double in,
                              double power)
        Transforms the input to a power curve in (0, infinity), mirrored about x and y axes.
        Parameters:
        in - the input variable
        power - the power to raise it to
        Returns:
        sign(in) * abs(in)^power

      • limitToSignless

        public static double limitToSignless(double in,
                                     double limit)

      • normalize

        public static double[] normalize(double[] powers,
                                 double to)
        Normalizes powers. Also known as "proportional constrain" Finds the largest magnitude power, and if it is over the limit, scales all powers down by a factor so they fit within the limit. Why? Useful to produce "proper" responses for drivetrains that preserve relative power, but not absolute power (you can't output 200% power)
        Parameters:
        powers - array of powers to normalize
        to - maximum value allowable
        Returns:
        array of powers, normalized

      • normalize

        public static double[] normalize(double[] powers)
        Normalizes powers to 1.
        Parameters:
        powers -
        Returns:
        normalize(powers, 1);
